founding_quotes.author: George Washington
founding_quotes.quote: Liberty, when it begins to take root, is a plant of rapid growth.

founding_quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson
founding_quotes.quote: We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal.

founding_quotes.author: John Adams
founding_quotes.quote: Liberty cannot be preserved without a general knowledge among the people.

founding_quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
founding_quotes.quote: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.

founding_quotes.author: James Madison
founding_quotes.quote: The advancement and diffusion of knowledge is the only guardian of true liberty.

founding_quotes.author: Alexander Hamilton
founding_quotes.quote: A nation which can prefer disgrace to danger is prepared for a master and deserves one.

founding_quotes.author: Patrick Henry
founding_quotes.quote: Give me liberty, or give me death!

founding_quotes.author: Thomas Paine
founding_quotes.quote: The cause of America is in a great measure the cause of all mankind.

founding_quotes.author: Samuel Adams
founding_quotes.quote: It does not require a majority to prevail, but rather an irate, tireless minority, keen on setting brushfires of freedom in the minds of men.

founding_quotes.author: George Mason
founding_quotes.quote: All men are by nature equally free and independent, and have certain inherent rights.

founding_quotes.author: John Jay
founding_quotes.quote: The security of our liberties depends upon our unity.

founding_quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson
founding_quotes.quote: The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants.

founding_quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
founding_quotes.quote: Justice will not be served until those who are unaffected are as outraged as those who are.

founding_quotes.author: John Adams
founding_quotes.quote: There is nothing I dread so much as the division of the republic into two great parties.

founding_quotes.author: James Madison
founding_quotes.quote: The means of defense against foreign danger historically have become the instruments of tyranny at home.

founding_quotes.author: George Washington
founding_quotes.quote: The basis of our political systems is the right of the people to make and to alter their constitutions of government.

founding_quotes.author: Thomas Paine
founding_quotes.quote: These are the times that try men's souls.

founding_quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin
founding_quotes.quote: In free governments, the rulers are the servants, and the people their superiors and sovereigns.

founding_quotes.author: George Washington
founding_quotes.quote: Observe good faith and justice toward all nations. Cultivate peace and harmony with all.

founding_quotes.author: Patrick Henry
founding_quotes.quote: The Constitution is not an instrument for the government to restrain the people, it is an instrument for the people to restrain the government.

founding_quotes.author: John Adams
founding_quotes.quote: Our Constitution was made only for a moral and religious people. It is wholly inadequate to the government of any other.
